title: How to Play 1v1 on Call of Duty Mobile

steps.title: Find the “Multiplayer” button on the home screen.
steps.content: Find the “Multiplayer” button on the home screen. Look on the right-hand side of the home page to find a list of game modes. “Multiplayer” is typically the second option down, between “Ranked Match” and “Battle Royale.” [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the ≣ Menu button in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap the ≣ Menu button in the top-right corner. The menu button pulls up a vertical list of options, with “Private” being at the very bottom. Hit “Private” to close your game off to strangers so only your friends can join. [2] X Research source The app will now redirect you to a private multiplayer game lobby.

steps.title: Use the “Mode Change” option to make your adjustments.
steps.content: Use the “Mode Change” option to make your adjustments. Look for a bright yellow button in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen with a icon on it. Using the horizontal menu that pops up, select the “1v1 Duel” option to create an exclusive face-off for you and your friend. [3] X Research source Don’t worry about changing the game parameters or presets. The game automatically applies settings meant for a 1v1 match. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Hit the “Invite” panel on the right side of the screen.
steps.content: Hit the “Invite” panel on the right side of the screen. Any online friends will be highlighted on the panel—just tap their names to send them an invite to your 1v1. Their username and icon pops up in your private multiplayer lobby as soon as they accept the invitation. [5] X Research source If you don’t have your friend added yet, hit the third tab on top of the “Invite” panel and search for their username.

steps.title: Enjoy a fun battle without worrying about your rank.
steps.content: Enjoy a fun battle without worrying about your rank. CoD: Mobile classifies 1v1 Duels as custom games rather than as established matches. Because of this, your match-up won’t positively or negatively impact your rank. With this in mind, feel free to challenge your friends of all skill levels to 1v1 matches! [6] X Research source
